net.foxycorndog.jdoogl

Class GL

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jdoogl.GL

  • public class GL
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for accessing many static methods that incorporate OpenGL.
    Since:
    Fri May 25 10:29:08 AM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public static void update()

      • setFrontFace

        public static void setFrontFace(int face)
        Set the order in which you input the vertices to be define the front of a polygon. if CLOCKWISE, then if you input the vertices in a clockwise fashion, then it is the front. vice- versa with the COUNTER_CLOCKWISE constant.
        Parameters:
        face - CLOCKWISE or COUNTER_CLOCKWISE.

      • setColorf

        public static void setColorf(float r,
             float g,
             float b,
             float a)
        Set the color to the specified float values. Default color is (1, 1, 1, 1)
        Parameters:
        r - The red value. (0.0f - 1.0f)
        g - The green value. (0.0f - 1.0f)
        b - The blue value. (0.0f - 1.0f)
        a - The alpha value. (0.0f - 1.0f)

      • setColori

        public static void setColori(int r,
             int g,
             int b,
             int a)
        Sets the color to the specified integer vales. Default color is (255, 255, 255, 255) This is the more known way of setting rgb colors.
        Parameters:
        r - The red value (0 - 255)
        g - The green value (0 - 255)
        b - The blue value (0 - 255)
        a - The alpha value (0 - 255)

      • setClearColorf

        public static void setClearColorf(float r,
                  float g,
                  float b,
                  float a)
        Set the color in which the screen will clear to, to the specified float values. Default color is (1, 1, 1, 1).
        Parameters:
        r - The red value. (0.0f - 1.0f)
        g - The green value. (0.0f - 1.0f)
        b - The blue value. (0.0f - 1.0f)
        a - The alpha value. (0.0f - 1.0f)

      • setClearColori

        public static void setClearColori(int r,
                  int g,
                  int b,
                  int a)
        Set the color in which the screen will clear to, to the specified integer values. Default color is (255, 255, 255, 255).
        Parameters:
        r - The red value (0 - 255)
        g - The green value (0 - 255)
        b - The blue value (0 - 255)
        a - The alpha value (0 - 255)

      • renderQuadRect

        public static void renderQuadRect(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  net.foxycorndog.jdoutil.VerticesBuffer verticesBuffer,
                  net.foxycorndog.jdoutil.LightBuffer texturesBuffer,
                  ImageMap imageMap,
                  int arrayWidth,
                  int arrayHeight,
                  int vertexSize)
        Renders all of the rectangles within the specified dimensions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x offset to render.
        y - The y offset to render.
        width - The width of the amount of rectangles to render.
        height - The height of the amount of rectangles to render.
        verticesBuffer - The LightBuffer that holds the information for the vertices.
        texturesBuffer - The LightBuffer that holds the information for the texture offsets.
        imageMap - The ImageMap that will be bound and used for drawing the textures.
        arrayWidth - The width of the buffer array to loop through.
        arrayHeight - The height of the buffer array to loop through.

      • renderQuadRect

        public static void renderQuadRect(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  int arrayWidth,
                  int arrayHeight)
        Renders all of the rectangles within the specified dimensions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x offset to render.
        y - The y offset to render.
        width - The width of the amount of rectangles to render.
        height - The height of the amount of rectangles to render.
        arrayWidth - The width of the buffer array to loop through.
        arrayHeight - The height of the buffer array to loop through.

      • beginManipulation

        public static void beginManipulation()
        Begins the manipulation of the current matrix.

      • endManipulation

        public static void endManipulation()
        Ends the manipulation of the current matrix and returns to the matrix before beginManipulation() was called.

      • enableClipping

        public static void enableClipping()
        Enables the ability to clip a part of the screen for rendering.

      • endClipping

        public static void endClipping()
        Ends the ability to clip a part of the screen for rendering.

      • enableInverting

        public static void enableInverting()
        Enables the ability to invert anything rendered.

      • endInverting

        public static void endInverting()
        Ends the ability to invert anything rendered.

      • beginInverting

        public static void beginInverting()
        Begin inverting everything rendered according to the opposite of their rgb values.

      • beginInvertingBackground

        public static void beginInvertingBackground()
        Begins inverting everything rendered according to whatever is being rendered behind it.

      • beginXOR

        public static void beginXOR()
        Begins inverting everything by XORing them.

      • beginClipping

        public static void beginClipping(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Begins clipping the render frame at the specified position with the specified dimensions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position on the Frame to start clipping.
        y - The y position of the Frame to start clipping.
        width - The width of the area to be not clipped out.
        height - The height of the area to be not clipped out.
